text: The Western Schism was a split between factions of the Roman Catholic Church between 1378 and 1417. "Western Schism," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2011-11-29. During this period, more than one claimed to be the true pope. The reasons for the split were mostly political, rather than theological. The Council of Constance (1414â€“1418) ended the schism when they elected Martin V as the new pope. ==References== ==Other websites == Category:Roman Catholicism
title: Western Schism
